title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
hello

working on a 820-4924
board is very clean, no liquid damage..

keyboard does not work
tried it on a different case with good known keyboard \ trackpad and all good cables - still doesn't work..

with external keyboard works fine..

the keyboard does work when clicking the power button, smc reset
but does not work on pram reset or alt on boot for option menu...

i checked on j4813 and it has 3.42v on pin 4 and 3.3v on pin 30

any thoughts will be appreciated...

thanks..

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message: Get a NEW trackpad cable first. These fail all the time so order 5.

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
hi duke

thanks for the quick answer
i replaced the trackpad cable twice with two known good cables and no good...

also, put another logicboard into this shell and it works good, detects keyboard and works well
so it leads me to think that something is wrong with the board..

what can i check with it?
what the voltage should be on the rest of the connector pins?

thanks..

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message: Is the trackpad working? Does it klick?

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
hi

i just put this logicboard into a working machine, and did some more diagnosing..

the trackpad is clicking when the machine is powered on..

with the trackpad and keyboard connected i can't even use usb keyboard
BUT... when disconnecting the trackpad, i can get the usb keyboard to work
when connecting back the trackpad, the usb keyboard stop to work..

couldn't get the mac's keyboard to work...

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message: But the trackpad cannot move the mouse pointer? Only click is working?

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
i got the logicboard alone, no OS or ssd

as i mentioned... with the trackpad connected nothing respond
not even usb keyboard, so even if i put an ssd with OS
i always get to the flashing question mark...

so i can't know if it moves..
i only get click when it's powers on...

will try to check again, try to get to recovery mode with the keyboard
to see if trackpad moves...

is there anything to diagnose or measure around 
the board to try and figure this out?

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
Acces boot menu and see if trackpad works in that moment (before OSX charged).
At that time, trackpad talks with PCH through USB only...

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
can't load boot menu

doesn't respond to alt key and also not to command+r

actually nothing response as long as the trackpad is connected
also no usb keyboard, so there is no way to know if trackpad moves..

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
Trackpad is connected to PCH through USB.
That is the way both talk before OSX is charged.
Seems that trackpad blocks the USB completely.
Check resistance to ground on both lines, when trackpad connected.

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
i agree that it seems like trackpad is maybe causing short to ground
not by trackpad but on the logicboard...

where can i measure pch or usb while trackpad is connected \ disconnected?

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
:|

i don't see a way to check when the trackpad is connected...
can you say on which pin of the trackpad to measure?
maybe on the boardview there is another point to check from?

i also have a 820-00138 board with almost the exact same issue
didn't thought would be such a nightmare to diagnose trackpad issues...

i literately have no clue where to begin from... 
can't figure out the logic of it..

any directions will be appreciated..

thanks...

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message: USB_TPAD_P/N, use boardview to locate them...

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
hi

it's 11.5 k ohm on USB_TPAD_P
and 60k ohm on USB_TPAD_N

measure the same on a good board and it's the same..

the other side on this connection is the cpu so no way to measure when trackpad connected..

the PPVIN_S4_TPAD_FUSE is 12.56v is that normal?
on the schematic says 8.6v..

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message:
Mmmmh, cannot measure on the trackpad board???
Maybe easy to measure direct on the trackpad flex; on the terminal disconnected from logic board, with other terminal connected to trackpad...
Use ground from trackpad of course.

Bad values should be on trackpad side, if logic board values look good and it gets block only when trackpad is connected.

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message: Diode mode on all pins of trackpad connector?

title: 820-4924 no keyboard
message: Looks ok. L4803 may be suspect. Measure voltage on both sides with trackpad connected so there is a load on it. Have you also inspected the connector for damaged pins?
